meanings.definition: The addition of a word or phrase to clarify or explain a preceding word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: During the lecture, the professor provided an epexegesis to help us understand the complex term.
meanings.sent2: The textbook included an epexegesis at the end of each chapter to aid students in comprehension.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's epexegesis of the joke made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed epexegesis of the poem shed light on its deeper meaning.
meanings.sent5: The detective's epexegesis of the evidence revealed the true culprit.
